text: For decades, Betsey Johnson’s core business was making hot-pink prom dresses with black lace-up corsets and neon trim, selling well-mannered teens a dream of rebellion. After the 2008 crash, the Johnson brand found itself $48.8 million in debt. https://t.co/QcDQvkAFik

text: For people stuck at home and self-isolating, puzzles can be a satisfying pastime. For YouTube puzzler Chris Ramsay, they’re also a business. Watch Ramsay discuss how he makes millions solving puzzles. https://t.co/uhaXYRyxom

name: NewYorker
text: On this day in 1932, Amelia Earhart became the first woman to make a solo crossing over the Atlantic Ocean. Just five years later, she became the world’s most famous missing person, after her twin-engine Lockheed Electra disappeared. https://t.co/0bT5zZAPz5

text:

name: NewYorker
text: .@phoebe_bridgers started playing guitar seriously around age 13, after her mom tried to get her to learn piano. “I fucking hated being forced to do something. Reading music felt like math homework,” she said. “Guitar was my rebellion.” https://t.co/sFhnU0d5XH
